sentences: Delegates in this contact group exchanged views on the UNFCCC conference services contingency and the Chairs revised draft conclusions.
The G-77/CHINA asked whether the UN General Assemblys (UNGA) recent decision to fund UNFCCC conference services from the UN regular budget would be applied until 2006.
JAPAN said the new UNGA scale of assessment should be applied.
Stressing that adaptation is of greater concern to Central American countries than mitigation, HONDURAS noted its concern about the amount of funding budgeted for CDM activities.
Parties then deliberated on the six options outlined in the draft conclusions, unable to remove any of them.
The UNFCCC Executive Secretary noted that existing funds would only support activities until February 2004.
